text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Change order" means a written order that:
is signed by the procurement officer; and
directs the contractor to make changes that the procurement contract authorizes the procurement officer to order without the consent of the contractor.

"Contract modification" means a written alteration that:
affects specifications, delivery point, date of delivery, period of performance, price, quantity, or other provisions of a procurement contract; and
is accomplished by mutual action of the parties to the procurement contract.

"Cost-reimbursement contract" means a procurement contract under which the State reimburses a contractor for fees and other costs that are:
recognized as allowable and allocable under the regulations of the Board on price and cost principles; and
within a stated ceiling.
